# Cambridge International AS & A Level  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 171, 195, 202]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 214, 907, 255]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 278, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/33  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 303, 907, 320]]<|/det|>
October/November 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 450, 763, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 466, 809, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 482, 566, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 498, 487, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 528, 870, 558]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 559, 484, 573]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 574, 885, 603]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 603, 860, 633]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 666, 215, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 682, 388, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 697, 732, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(x\) satisfying the inequality \(\left|2^{x + 1} - 2\right| < 0.5\), giving your answer to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
On an Argand diagram, shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) satisfying the inequalities \(|z - 1 + 2\mathrm{i}| \leqslant |z|\) and \(|z - 2| \leqslant 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 920, 112]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(2x^{3} + ax^{2} + bx + 6\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants, is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). When \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x + 2)\) the remainder is \(- 38\) and when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((2x - 1)\) the remainder is \(\frac{19}{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 122, 332, 141]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 123, 920, 141]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 83, 94, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 710, 104]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of the stationary points of the curve \(y = \frac{\mathrm{e}^{3x^2 - 1}}{1 - x^2}.\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 81, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 717, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that the equation \(\cot^{2}\theta + 2\cos 2\theta = 4\) can be written in the form

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 100, 601, 120]]<|/det|>
\[4\sin^{4}\theta +3\sin^{2}\theta -1 = 0.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 100, 920, 119]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence find the coordinates of the points on the curve at which the tangent is parallel to the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 544, 92]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 100, 567, 131]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{e}^{4x}\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \cos^2 3y.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 138, 381, 157]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = 0\) when \(x = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 168, 917, 187]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, obtaining an expression for \(y\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 168, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[344, 88, 685, 300]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 319, 536, 339]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = x \cos 2x\), for \(x \geqslant 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 352, 146, 371]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 351, 720, 371]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point where \(x = \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 352, 920, 371]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the shaded region shown in the diagram, bounded by the curve and the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The line \(l\) has equation \(\mathbf{r} = \mathbf{i} - 2\mathbf{j} - 3\mathbf{k} + \lambda (-\mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} + 2\mathbf{k})\). The points \(A\) and \(B\) have position vectors \(-2\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} - \mathbf{k}\) and \(3\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k}\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 462, 138]]<|/det|>
Find a unit vector in the direction of \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 528, 485, 546]]<|/det|>
The line \(m\) passes through the points \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 558, 146, 576]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 558, 391, 576]]<|/det|>
Find a vector equation for \(m\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 558, 920, 576]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 693, 92]]<|/det|>
Determine whether lines \(l\) and \(m\) are parallel, intersect or are skew.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
